organization.$: Dept. of Imaging and Printing Technology

head.citation-title: Synthesis of poly[n-isopropylacrylamide-co-(acrylic acid)] nanogels via differential microemulsion polymerization
head.abstracts: A differential microemulsion polymerization (DMP) two-step process has been developed to prepare poly[N-isopropylacrylamide-co(acrylic acid)] (poly(NIPAM-co-AA)) nanogels, in which sodium dodecyl sulphate (SDS) was used as the surfactant. Poly(NIPAM-co-AA) nanogels have the properties of being a temperature-sensitive polymer. The functional groups and the thermoresponsive behavior of the resultant nanogels were confirmed by Fourier transform infrared spectroscopy (FT-IR) and UV-vis spectroscopy, respectively. The lower critical solution temperature (LCST) as well as the transition temperature of poly(NIPAM-co-AA) nanogels that are the key parameters of a temperature- sensitive polymer could be controlled by the amount of surfactant and the monomer mole ratio of N-isopropylacrylamide/acrylic acid (NIPAM/ AA). It was found that, in presence of surfactant, when increasing the amount of AA from 0 to 12.5 mole ratio of NIPAM, the LCST of nanogels shifted from 46 to 31 °C. © 2012, Advanced Engineering Solutions.
